#### 2. ÂàõÂª∫ÊãìÊâë

![upgit_20230320_1679292214.png](https://gitee.com/rykren/images/raw/master/2023/03/upgit_20230320_1679292214.png)

```yaml
name: bgp
topology:
  nodes:
    spine1:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/vyos:1.4
      cmd: /sbin/init
      binds:
        - /lib/modules:/lib/modules

    spine2:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/vyos:1.4
      cmd: /sbin/init
      binds:
        - /lib/modules:/lib/modules

    leaf1:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/vyos:1.4
      cmd: /sbin/init
      binds:
        - /lib/modules:/lib/modules

    leaf2: 
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/vyos:1.4
      cmd: /sbin/init
      binds:
        - /lib/modules:/lib/modules


    server1:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      network-mode: container:cluster-control-plane
      exec:
      - ip addr add 10.1.5.11/24 dev net0
      - ip route replace default via 10.1.5.1
    server2:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      network-mode: container:cluster-worker
      exec:
      - ip addr add 10.1.5.12/24 dev net0
      - ip route replace default via 10.1.5.1

    server3:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      network-mode: container:cluster-worker2
      exec:
      - ip addr add 10.1.8.13/24 dev net0
      - ip route replace default via 10.1.8.1

    server4:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      network-mode: container:cluster-worker3
      exec:
      - ip addr add 10.1.8.14/24 dev net0
      - ip route replace default via 10.1.8.1

  links:
  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth1", "spine1:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth2", "spine2:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth3", "server1:net0"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth4", "server2:net0"]

  - endpoints: ["leaf2:eth1", "spine1:eth2"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf2:eth2", "spine2:eth2"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf2:eth3", "server3:net0"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf2:eth4", "server4:net0"]
```
`clab deploy -t spine-leaf.yaml`

  peerIP: 10.1.5.1
  asNumber: 65005

ÈÄöÂ∏∏ÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ã, ÊØèÂº†ÁΩëÂç°Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈòüÂàó(queue), ÊâÄÊúâÊî∂Âà∞ÁöÑÂåÖ‰ªéËøô‰∏™ÈòüÂàóÂÖ•, ÂÜÖÊ†∏‰ªéËøô‰∏™ÈòüÂàóÈáåÂèñÊï∞ÊçÆÂ§ÑÁêÜ. ËØ•ÈòüÂàóÂÖ∂ÂÆûÊòØring buffer(ÁéØÂΩ¢ÈòüÂàó), ÂÜÖÊ†∏Â¶ÇÊûúÂèñÊï∞ÊçÆ‰∏çÂèäÊó∂, Âàô‰ºöÂ≠òÂú®‰∏¢ÂåÖÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ.

ÊâÄ‰ª•ÁΩëÂç°ÂºÄÂèë‰∫ÜÂ§öÈòüÂàóÂäüËÉΩ, Âç≥‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁΩëÂç°ÊúâÂ§ö‰∏™ÈòüÂàó, Êî∂Âà∞ÁöÑÂåÖÊ†πÊçÆTCPÂõõÂÖÉÁªÑ‰ø°ÊÅØhashÂêéÊîæÂÖ•ÂÖ∂‰∏≠‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈòüÂàó, ÂêéÈù¢ËØ•ÈìæÊé•ÁöÑÊâÄÊúâÂåÖÈÉΩÊîæÂÖ•ËØ•ÈòüÂàó. ÊØè‰∏™ÈòüÂàóÂØπÂ∫î‰∏çÂêåÁöÑ‰∏≠Êñ≠, ‰ΩøÁî®irqbalanceÂ∞Ü‰∏çÂêåÁöÑ‰∏≠Êñ≠ÁªëÂÆöÂà∞‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÊ†∏. ÂÖÖÂàÜÂà©Áî®‰∫ÜÂ§öÊ†∏Âπ∂Ë°åÂ§ÑÁêÜÁâπÊÄß. ÊèêÈ´ò‰∫ÜÊïàÁéá.

ringbufferÊòØÁΩëÂç°Êî∂ÂèëÊä•ÊñáÁöÑÁºìÂÜ≤Âå∫„ÄÇringÁöÑÊÑèÊÄùÂ∞±ÊòØÁéØÂΩ¢ÔºåÊï∞ÊçÆÂæÄÁéØÈáåÂèØ‰ª•‰∏çÂÅúÂÜôÂÖ•ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂà∞‰∫ÜÂ§¥ÔºåÂ∞±‰ºöÂÜçÂÜô‰∏ÄÂúàÔºåÊääËÄÅÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆË¶ÜÁõñ‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

# The Kernel protocol is not a real routing protocol. Instead of communicating
# with other routers in the network, it performs synchronization of BIRD's
# routing tables with the OS kernel.
protocol kernel {
  learn;             # Learn all alien routes from the kernel
  persist;           # Don't remove routes on bird shutdown
  scan time 2;       # Scan kernel routing table every 2 seconds
  import all;
  export all; # Default is export none
  graceful restart;  # Turn on graceful restart
  merge paths on;    # Allow export multipath routes (ECMP)
}

# The Device protocol is not a real routing protocol. It doesn't generate any
# routes and it only serves as a module for getting information about network
# interfaces from the kernel. 
# Watch interface up/down events.
protocol device {
        scan time 2;
}


template bgp bgp_template {
        debug all;                                  # debug BGP
        description "BIRD RR";
        local as 64512;                             # the AS used by the local BGP speaker
        multihop;                                   # was not default in 1.3.11
        gateway recursive;
        import all;
        export all;
        add paths on;
        graceful restart;
        connect delay time 2;
        connect retry time 5;
        error wait time 5,30;
        source address 172.16.10.1;                # Source BGP from this IP address

        #rr client;                                  # make defined neighbors rr clients
        #rr cluster id 172.16.10.1;
        #igp table master;                           # necessary to resolve the next-hop
        #hold time 30;                               # hold time send in BGP messages
}

# For peer /host/node/peer_v4/172.16.0.1
protocol bgp Node_172_16_0_1 from bgp_template {
  neighbor 172.16.0.1 as 64512;
}

# For peer /host/node/peer_v4/172.16.10.13
protocol bgp Node_172_16_10_13 from bgp_template {
  neighbor 172.16.10.13 as 64512;
  rr client;
  rr cluster id 172.16.10.1;
}


# For peer /host/node/peer_v4/172.16.10.14
protocol bgp Node_172_16_10_14 from bgp_template {
  neighbor 172.16.10.14 as 64512;
  rr client;
  rr cluster id 172.16.10.1;
}
```

``` shell
rq_count=`ls /sys/class/net/eth10/queues/rx-* -d | wc -l`  
rps_flow_cnt_value=`expr 32768 / $rq_count`  

for ((i=0; i< $rq_count; i++))  
do  
  echo $rps_flow_cnt_value > /sys/class/net/eth10/queues/rx-$i/rps_flow_cnt  
done  

flag=0  
while [ -f /sys/class/net/eth10/queues/rx-$flag/rps_cpus ]  
do  
  echo `cat  /sys/class/net/eth10/queues/rx-$flag/rps_cpus | sed 's/0/f/g' ` >  /sys/class/net/eth10/queues/rx-$flag/rps_cpus  
  flag=$(($flag+1))  
done
echo 32768 > /proc/sys/net/core/rps_sock_flow_entries  
sysctl -p
```

Áî±‰∫éËøôÂ•óËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™Êú∫Âà∂ÊòØÁã¨Á´ã‰∫é Netfilter ÁöÑÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§ÂÆÉÁöÑ conntrack Âíå NAT ‰ø°ÊÅØ‰πüÊ≤°Êúâ Â≠òÂÇ®Âú®ÂÜÖÊ†∏ÁöÑÔºà‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØ Netfilter ÁöÑÔºâconntrack table Âíå NAT table„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•Â∏∏ËßÑÁöÑ¬†`conntrack/netstats/ss/lsof`¬†Á≠âÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÊòØÁúã‰∏çÂà∞ÁöÑÔºåË¶Å‰ΩøÁî® Cilium ÁöÑÂëΩ‰ª§Ôºå‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºö

## 3.2¬†`struct nf_conntrack_tuple {}`ÔºöÂÖÉÁªÑÔºàTupleÔºâ

Tuple ÊòØËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™‰∏≠ÊúÄÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÊ¶ÇÂøµ‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇ

**‰∏Ä‰∏™ tuple ÂÆö‰πâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂçïÂêëÔºàunidirectionalÔºâflow**„ÄÇÂÜÖÊ†∏‰ª£Á†Å‰∏≠ÊúâÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÊ≥®ÈáäÔºö

> //include/net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_tuple.h
> 
> A¬†`tuple`¬†is a structure containing the information to uniquely identify a connection. ie. if two packets have the same tuple, they are in the same connection; if not, they are not.

### ÁªìÊûÑ‰ΩìÂÆö‰πâ

```
//include/net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_tuple.h

// ‰∏∫Êñπ‰æø NAT ÁöÑÂÆûÁé∞ÔºåÂÜÖÊ†∏Â∞Ü tuple ÁªìÊûÑ‰ΩìÊãÜÂàÜ‰∏∫ "manipulatable" Âíå "non-manipulatable" ‰∏§ÈÉ®ÂàÜ
// ‰∏ãÈù¢ÁªìÊûÑ‰Ωì‰∏≠ÁöÑ _man ÊòØ manipulatable ÁöÑÁº©ÂÜô
                                               // ude/uapi/linux/netfilter.h
                                               union nf_inet_addr {
                                                   __u32            all[4];
                                                   __be32           ip;
                                                   __be32           ip6[4];
                                                   struct in_addr   in;
                                                   struct in6_addr  in6;
/* manipulable part of the tuple */         /  };
struct nf_conntrack_man {                  /
    union nf_inet_addr           u3; -->--/
    union nf_conntrack_man_proto u;  -->--\
                                           \   // include/uapi/linux/netfilter/nf_conntrack_tuple_common.h
    u_int16_t l3num; // L3 proto            \  // ÂçèËÆÆÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÈÉ®ÂàÜ
};                                            union nf_conntrack_man_proto {
                                                  __be16 all;/* Add other protocols here. */

                                                  struct { __be16 port; } tcp;
                                                  struct { __be16 port; } udp;
                                                  struct { __be16 id;   } icmp;
                                                  struct { __be16 port; } dccp;
                                                  struct { __be16 port; } sctp;
                                                  struct { __be16 key;  } gre;
                                              };

struct nf_conntrack_tuple { /* This contains the information to distinguish a connection. */
    struct nf_conntrack_man src;  // Ê∫êÂú∞ÂùÄ‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåmanipulable part
    struct {
        union nf_inet_addr u3;
        union {
            __be16 all; /* Add other protocols here. */

            struct { __be16 port;         } tcp;
            struct { __be16 port;         } udp;
            struct { u_int8_t type, code; } icmp;
            struct { __be16 port;         } dccp;
            struct { __be16 port;         } sctp;
            struct { __be16 key;          } gre;
        } u;
        u_int8_t protonum; /* The protocol. */
        u_int8_t dir;      /* The direction (for tuplehash) */
    } dst;                       // ÁõÆÁöÑÂú∞ÂùÄ‰ø°ÊÅØ
};
```

**Tuple ÁªìÊûÑ‰Ωì‰∏≠Âè™Êúâ‰∏§‰∏™Â≠óÊÆµ src Âíå dst**ÔºåÂàÜÂà´‰øùÂ≠òÊ∫êÂíåÁõÆÁöÑ‰ø°ÊÅØ„ÄÇ`src`¬†Âíå¬†`dst`¬†Ëá™Ë∫´‰πüÊòØÁªìÊûÑ‰ΩìÔºåËÉΩ‰øùÂ≠ò‰∏çÂêåÁ±ªÂûãÂçèËÆÆÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇ‰ª• IPv4 UDP ‰∏∫‰æãÔºå‰∫îÂÖÉÁªÑÂàÜÂà´‰øùÂ≠òÂú®Â¶Ç‰∏ãÂ≠óÊÆµÔºö

-   `dst.protonum`ÔºöÂçèËÆÆÁ±ªÂûã
-   `src.u3.ip`ÔºöÊ∫ê IP Âú∞ÂùÄ
-   `dst.u3.ip`ÔºöÁõÆÁöÑ IP Âú∞ÂùÄ
-   `src.u.udp.port`ÔºöÊ∫êÁ´ØÂè£Âè∑
-   `dst.u.udp.port`ÔºöÁõÆÁöÑÁ´ØÂè£Âè∑

‰ªé‰ª•‰∏äÂÆö‰πâÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞ÔºåËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™Ê®°Âùó**ÁõÆÂâçÂè™ÊîØÊåÅ‰ª•‰∏ãÂÖ≠ÁßçÂçèËÆÆ**ÔºöTCP„ÄÅUDP„ÄÅICMP„ÄÅDCCP„ÄÅSCTP„ÄÅGRE„ÄÇ

## 3.4¬†`struct nf_conntrack_tuple_hash {}`ÔºöÂìàÂ∏åË°®È°π

conntrack Â∞ÜÊ¥ªÂä®ËøûÊé•ÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅÂ≠òÂÇ®Âú®‰∏ÄÂº†ÂìàÂ∏åË°®‰∏≠Ôºà`key: value`Ôºâ„ÄÇ

`hash_conntrack_raw()`¬†Ê†πÊçÆ tuple ËÆ°ÁÆóÂá∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ 32 ‰ΩçÁöÑÂìàÂ∏åÂÄºÔºàkeyÔºâÔºö

```
// net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_core.c

static u32 hash_conntrack_raw(struct nf_conntrack_tuple *tuple, struct net *net)
{
    get_random_once(&nf_conntrack_hash_rnd, sizeof(nf_conntrack_hash_rnd));

    /* The direction must be ignored, so we hash everything up to the
     * destination ports (which is a multiple of 4) and treat the last three bytes manually.  */
    u32 seed = nf_conntrack_hash_rnd ^ net_hash_mix(net);
    unsigned int n = (sizeof(tuple->src) + sizeof(tuple->dst.u3)) / sizeof(u32);

    return jhash2((u32 *)tuple, n, seed ^ ((tuple->dst.u.all << 16) | tuple->dst.protonum));
}
```

Ê≥®ÊÑèÂÖ∂‰∏≠ÊòØÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂà©Áî® tuple ÁöÑ‰∏çÂêåÂ≠óÊÆµÊù•ËÆ°ÁÆóÂìàÂ∏åÁöÑ„ÄÇ

    struct nf_conntrack_tuple tuple;    // N ÂÖÉÁªÑÔºåÂâçÈù¢ËØ¶ÁªÜ‰ªãÁªçËøá‰∫Ü
};

// include/uapi/linux/netfilter/nf_conntrack_common.h

enum ip_conntrack_status {
    IPS_EXPECTED      = (1 << IPS_EXPECTED_BIT),
    IPS_SEEN_REPLY    = (1 << IPS_SEEN_REPLY_BIT),
    IPS_ASSURED       = (1 << IPS_ASSURED_BIT),
    IPS_CONFIRMED     = (1 << IPS_CONFIRMED_BIT),
    IPS_SRC_NAT       = (1 << IPS_SRC_NAT_BIT),
    IPS_DST_NAT       = (1 << IPS_DST_NAT_BIT),
    IPS_NAT_MASK      = (IPS_DST_NAT | IPS_SRC_NAT),
    IPS_SEQ_ADJUST    = (1 << IPS_SEQ_ADJUST_BIT),
    IPS_SRC_NAT_DONE  = (1 << IPS_SRC_NAT_DONE_BIT),
    IPS_DST_NAT_DONE  = (1 << IPS_DST_NAT_DONE_BIT),
    IPS_NAT_DONE_MASK = (IPS_DST_NAT_DONE | IPS_SRC_NAT_DONE),
    IPS_DYING         = (1 << IPS_DYING_BIT),
    IPS_FIXED_TIMEOUT = (1 << IPS_FIXED_TIMEOUT_BIT),
    IPS_TEMPLATE      = (1 << IPS_TEMPLATE_BIT),
    IPS_UNTRACKED     = (1 << IPS_UNTRACKED_BIT),
    IPS_HELPER        = (1 << IPS_HELPER_BIT),
    IPS_OFFLOAD       = (1 << IPS_OFFLOAD_BIT),

    IPS_UNCHANGEABLE_MASK = (IPS_NAT_DONE_MASK | IPS_NAT_MASK |
                 IPS_EXPECTED | IPS_CONFIRMED | IPS_DYING |
                 IPS_SEQ_ADJUST | IPS_TEMPLATE | IPS_OFFLOAD),
};
```

## 3.6¬†`nf_conntrack_in()`ÔºöËøõÂÖ•ËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™
![upgit_20221117_1668675210.png](https://gitee.com/rykren/images/raw/master/2022/11/upgit_20221117_1668675210.png)

<center>Fig. Netfilter ‰∏≠ÁöÑËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™ÁÇπ</center>

Â¶Ç‰∏äÂõæÊâÄÁ§∫ÔºåNetfilter Âú®Âõõ‰∏™ Hook ÁÇπÂØπÂåÖËøõË°åË∑üË∏™Ôºö

1.  `PRE_ROUTING`¬†Âíå¬†`LOCAL_OUT`Ôºö**Ë∞ÉÁî® nf_conntrack_in() ÂºÄÂßãËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™**Ôºå Ê≠£Â∏∏ÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ã‰ºöÂàõÂª∫‰∏ÄÊù°Êñ∞ËøûÊé•ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÂ∞Ü conntrack entry ÊîæÂà∞¬†**unconfirmed list**„ÄÇ
    
    ‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàÊòØËøô‰∏§‰∏™ hook ÁÇπÂë¢ÔºüÂõ†‰∏∫ÂÆÉ‰ª¨ÈÉΩÊòØ**Êñ∞ËøûÊé•ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂåÖÊúÄÂÖàËææÂà∞ÁöÑÂú∞Êñπ**Ôºå
    
    -   `PRE_ROUTING`¬†ÊòØ**Â§ñÈÉ®‰∏ªÂä®ÂíåÊú¨Êú∫Âª∫Ëøû**Êó∂ÂåÖÊúÄÂÖàÂà∞ËææÁöÑÂú∞Êñπ
    -   `LOCAL_OUT`¬†ÊòØ**Êú¨Êú∫‰∏ªÂä®ÂíåÂ§ñÈÉ®Âª∫Ëøû**Êó∂ÂåÖÊúÄÂÖàÂà∞ËææÁöÑÂú∞Êñπ
2.  `POST_ROUTING`¬†Âíå¬†`LOCAL_IN`Ôºö**Ë∞ÉÁî® nf_conntrack_confirm() Â∞Ü nf_conntrack_in() ÂàõÂª∫ÁöÑËøûÊé•ÁßªÂà∞ confirmed list**„ÄÇ
    
    ÂêåÊ†∑Ë¶ÅÈóÆÔºå‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàÂú®Ëøô‰∏§‰∏™ hook ÁÇπÂë¢ÔºüÂõ†‰∏∫Â¶ÇÊûúÊñ∞ËøûÊé•ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂåÖÊ≤°ÊúâË¢´‰∏¢ÂºÉÔºåÈÇ£Ëøô ÊòØÂÆÉ‰ª¨**Á¶ªÂºÄ netfilter ‰πãÂâçÁöÑÊúÄÂêé hook ÁÇπ**Ôºö
    
    -   **Â§ñÈÉ®‰∏ªÂä®ÂíåÊú¨Êú∫Âª∫Ëøû**ÁöÑÂåÖÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂú®‰∏≠Èó¥Â§ÑÁêÜ‰∏≠Ê≤°ÊúâË¢´‰∏¢ÂºÉÔºå`LOCAL_IN`¬†ÊòØÂÖ∂Ë¢´ÈÄÅÂà∞Â∫îÁî®Ôºà‰æãÂ¶Ç nginx ÊúçÂä°Ôºâ‰πãÂâçÁöÑÊúÄÂêé hook ÁÇπ
    -   **Êú¨Êú∫‰∏ªÂä®ÂíåÂ§ñÈÉ®Âª∫Ëøû**ÁöÑÂåÖÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂú®‰∏≠Èó¥Â§ÑÁêÜ‰∏≠Ê≤°ÊúâË¢´‰∏¢ÂºÉÔºå`POST_ROUTING`¬†ÊòØÂÖ∂Á¶ªÂºÄ‰∏ªÊú∫Êó∂ÁöÑÊúÄÂêé hook ÁÇπ

‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑ‰ª£Á†ÅÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞**Ëøô‰∫õ handler ÊòØÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÊ≥®ÂÜåÂà∞ Netfilter hook ÁÇπÁöÑ**Ôºö

```
// net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_proto.c

/* Connection tracking may drop packets, but never alters them, so make it the first hook.  */
static const struct nf_hook_ops ipv4_conntrack_ops[] = {
    {
        .hook        = ipv4_conntrack_in,       // Ë∞ÉÁî® nf_conntrack_in() ËøõÂÖ•ËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™
        .pf          = NFPROTO_IPV4,

    {

        .pf          = NFPROTO_IPV4,

    },
    {

        .pf          = NFPROTO_IPV4,

`nf_conntrack_in()`¬†ÊòØ**ËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™Ê®°ÂùóÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉ**„ÄÇ

```
// net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_core.c

unsigned int
nf_conntrack_in(struct net *net, u_int8_t pf, unsigned int hooknum, struct sk_buff *skb)
{
  struct nf_conn *tmpl = nf_ct_get(skb, &ctinfo); // Ëé∑Âèñ skb ÂØπÂ∫îÁöÑ conntrack_info ÂíåËøûÊé•ËÆ∞ÂΩï
  if (tmpl || ctinfo == IP_CT_UNTRACKED) {        // Â¶ÇÊûúËÆ∞ÂΩïÂ≠òÂú®ÔºåÊàñËÄÖÊòØ‰∏çÈúÄË¶ÅË∑üË∏™ÁöÑÁ±ªÂûã
      if ((tmpl && !nf_ct_is_template(tmpl)) || ctinfo == IP_CT_UNTRACKED) {
          NF_CT_STAT_INC_ATOMIC(net, ignore);     // Êó†ÈúÄË∑üË∏™ÁöÑÁ±ªÂûãÔºåÂ¢ûÂä† ignore ËÆ°Êï∞
          return NF_ACCEPT;                       // ËøîÂõû NF_ACCEPTÔºåÁªßÁª≠ÂêéÈù¢ÁöÑÂ§ÑÁêÜ
      }
      skb->_nfct = 0;                             // ‰∏çÂ±û‰∫é ignore Á±ªÂûãÔºåËÆ°Êï∞Âô®ÁΩÆÈõ∂ÔºåÂáÜÂ§áÂêéÁª≠Â§ÑÁêÜ
  }

  struct nf_conntrack_l4proto *l4proto = __nf_ct_l4proto_find(...);    // ÊèêÂèñÂçèËÆÆÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑ L4 Â§¥‰ø°ÊÅØ

  if (l4proto->error != NULL) {                   // skb ÁöÑÂÆåÊï¥ÊÄßÂíåÂêàÊ≥ïÊÄßÈ™åËØÅ
      if (l4proto->error(net, tmpl, skb, dataoff, pf, hooknum) <= 0) {
          NF_CT_STAT_INC_ATOMIC(net, error);
          NF_CT_STAT_INC_ATOMIC(net, invalid);
          goto out;
      }
  }

repeat:
  // ÂºÄÂßãËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™ÔºöÊèêÂèñ tupleÔºõÂàõÂª∫Êñ∞ËøûÊé•ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåÊàñËÄÖÊõ¥Êñ∞Â∑≤ÊúâËøûÊé•ÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅ
  resolve_normal_ct(net, tmpl, skb, ... l4proto);

  l4proto->packet(ct, skb, dataoff, ctinfo); // ËøõË°å‰∏Ä‰∫õÂçèËÆÆÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÂ§ÑÁêÜÔºå‰æãÂ¶Ç UDP ‰ºöÊõ¥Êñ∞ timeout

  if (ctinfo == IP_CT_ESTABLISHED_REPLY && !test_and_set_bit(IPS_SEEN_REPLY_BIT, &ct->status))
      nf_conntrack_event_cache(IPCT_REPLY, ct);
out:
  if (tmpl)
      nf_ct_put(tmpl); // Ëß£Èô§ÂØπËøûÊé•ËÆ∞ÂΩï tmpl ÁöÑÂºïÁî®
}
```

Â§ßËá¥ÊµÅÁ®ãÔºö

1.  Â∞ùËØïËé∑ÂèñËøô‰∏™ skb ÂØπÂ∫îÁöÑËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™ËÆ∞ÂΩï
2.  Âà§Êñ≠ÊòØÂê¶ÈúÄË¶ÅÂØπËøô‰∏™ÂåÖÂÅöËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏çÈúÄË¶ÅÔºåÊõ¥Êñ∞ ignore ËÆ°Êï∞Ôºà`conntrack -S`¬†ËÉΩÁúãÂà∞Ëøô‰∏™ËÆ°Êï∞ÔºâÔºå ËøîÂõû¬†`NF_ACCEPT`ÔºõÂ¶ÇÊûúÈúÄË¶ÅÔºåÂ∞±**ÂàùÂßãÂåñËøô‰∏™ skb ÁöÑÂºïÁî®ËÆ°Êï∞**„ÄÇ

5.  Ë∞ÉÁî®¬†`resolve_normal_ct()`¬†**ÂºÄÂßãËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™**ÔºåÂÆÉ‰ºöÂàõÂª∫Êñ∞ tupleÔºåÊñ∞ conntrack entryÔºåÊàñËÄÖÊõ¥Êñ∞Â∑≤ÊúâËøûÊé•ÁöÑÁä∂ÊÄÅ„ÄÇ
6. ## 3.7¬†`init_conntrack()`ÔºöÂàõÂª∫Êñ∞ËøûÊé•ËÆ∞ÂΩï

Â¶ÇÊûúËøûÊé•‰∏çÂ≠òÂú®Ôºàflow ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂåÖÔºâÔºå`resolve_normal_ct()`¬†‰ºöË∞ÉÁî®¬†`init_conntrack`¬†ÔºåÂêéËÄÖËøõËÄå‰ºöË∞ÉÁî®¬†`new()`¬†ÊñπÊ≥ïÂàõÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™Êñ∞ÁöÑ conntrack entry„ÄÇ

```
// include/net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_core.c

// Allocate a new conntrack
static noinline struct nf_conntrack_tuple_hash *
init_conntrack(struct net *net, struct nf_conn *tmpl,
           const struct nf_conntrack_tuple *tuple,
           const struct nf_conntrack_l4proto *l4proto,
           struct sk_buff *skb, unsigned int dataoff, u32 hash)
{
    struct nf_conn *ct;

    // ‰ªé conntrack table ‰∏≠ÂàÜÈÖç‰∏Ä‰∏™ entryÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂìàÂ∏åË°®Êª°‰∫ÜÔºå‰ºöÂú®ÂÜÖÊ†∏Êó•Âøó‰∏≠ÊâìÂç∞
    // "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet" ‰ø°ÊÅØÔºåÈÄöËøá `dmesg -T` ËÉΩÁúãÂà∞
    ct = __nf_conntrack_alloc(net, zone, tuple, &repl_tuple, GFP_ATOMIC, hash);

    l4proto->new(ct, skb, dataoff); // ÂçèËÆÆÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ï

    local_bh_disable();             // ÂÖ≥Èó≠ËΩØ‰∏≠Êñ≠
    if (net->ct.expect_count) {
        exp = nf_ct_find_expectation(net, zone, tuple);
        if (exp) {
            /* Welcome, Mr. Bond.  We've been expecting you... */
            __set_bit(IPS_EXPECTED_BIT, &ct->status);

            /* exp->master safe, refcnt bumped in nf_ct_find_expectation */
            ct->master = exp->master;
            ct->mark = exp->master->mark;
            ct->secmark = exp->master->secmark;
            NF_CT_STAT_INC(net, expect_new);
        }
    }

    /* Now it is inserted into the unconfirmed list, bump refcount */
    // Ëá≥Ê≠§Ëøô‰∏™Êñ∞ÁöÑ conntrack entry Â∑≤ÁªèË¢´ÊèíÂÖ• unconfirmed list
    nf_conntrack_get(&ct->ct_general);
    nf_ct_add_to_unconfirmed_list(ct);

    local_bh_enable();              // ÈáçÊñ∞ÊâìÂºÄËΩØ‰∏≠Êñ≠

    if (exp) {
        if (exp->expectfn)
            exp->expectfn(ct, exp);
        nf_ct_expect_put(exp);
    }

    return &ct->tuplehash[IP_CT_DIR_ORIGINAL];
}
```

## 3.8¬†`nf_conntrack_confirm()`ÔºöÁ°ÆËÆ§ÂåÖÊ≤°ÊúâË¢´‰∏¢ÂºÉ

`nf_conntrack_in()`¬†ÂàõÂª∫ÁöÑÊñ∞ conntrack entry ‰ºöÊèíÂÖ•Âà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™¬†**Êú™Á°ÆËÆ§ËøûÊé•**Ôºà unconfirmed connectionÔºâÂàóË°®„ÄÇ

Â¶ÇÊûúËøô‰∏™ÂåÖ‰πãÂêéÊ≤°ÊúâË¢´‰∏¢ÂºÉÔºåÈÇ£ÂÆÉÂú®ÁªèËøá¬†`POST_ROUTING`¬†Êó∂‰ºöË¢´¬†`nf_conntrack_confirm()`¬†ÊñπÊ≥ïÂ§ÑÁêÜÔºåÂéüÁêÜÊàë‰ª¨Âú®ÂàÜÊûêËøá‰∫Ü 3.6 ËäÇÁöÑÂºÄÂ§¥ÂàÜÊûêËøá‰∫Ü„ÄÇ¬†`nf_conntrack_confirm()`¬†ÂÆåÊàê‰πãÂêéÔºåÁä∂ÊÄÅÂ∞±Âèò‰∏∫‰∫Ü¬†`IPS_CONFIRMED`ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îËøûÊé•ËÆ∞ÂΩï‰ªé¬†**Êú™Á°ÆËÆ§ÂàóË°®**ÁßªÂà∞**Ê≠£Â∏∏**ÁöÑÂàóË°®„ÄÇ

‰πãÊâÄ‰ª•ÊääÂàõÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™Êñ∞ entry ÁöÑËøáÁ®ãÂàÜ‰∏∫ÂàõÂª∫ÔºànewÔºâÂíåÁ°ÆËÆ§ÔºàconfirmÔºâ‰∏§‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµ ÔºåÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫**ÂåÖÂú®ÁªèËøá nf_conntrack_in() ‰πãÂêéÔºåÂà∞Ëææ nf_conntrack_confirm() ‰πãÂâç ÔºåÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöË¢´ÂÜÖÊ†∏‰∏¢ÂºÉ**„ÄÇËøôÊ†∑‰ºöÂØºËá¥Á≥ªÁªüÊÆãÁïôÂ§ßÈáèÁöÑÂçäËøûÊé•Áä∂ÊÄÅËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåÂú®ÊÄßËÉΩÂíåÂÆâÂÖ®ÊÄß‰∏äÈÉΩ ÊòØÂæàÂ§ßÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇÂàÜ‰∏∫‰∏§Ê≠•‰πãÂêéÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Âä†Âø´ÂçäËøûÊé•Áä∂ÊÄÅ conntrack entry ÁöÑ GC„ÄÇ

```
// include/net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_core.h

/* Confirm a connection: returns NF_DROP if packet must be dropped. */
static inline int nf_conntrack_confirm(struct sk_buff *skb)
{
    struct nf_conn *ct = (struct nf_conn *)skb_nfct(skb);
    int ret = NF_ACCEPT;

    if (ct) {
        if (!nf_ct_is_confirmed(ct))
            ret = __nf_conntrack_confirm(skb);
        if (likely(ret == NF_ACCEPT))
            nf_ct_deliver_cached_events(ct);
    }
    return ret;
}
```

confirm ÈÄªËæëÔºåÁúÅÁï•‰∫ÜÂêÑÁßçÈîôËØØÂ§ÑÁêÜÈÄªËæëÔºö

```
// net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_core.c

/* Confirm a connection given skb; places it in hash table */
int
__nf_conntrack_confirm(struct sk_buff *skb)
{
    struct nf_conn *ct;
    ct = nf_ct_get(skb, &ctinfo);

    local_bh_disable();               // ÂÖ≥Èó≠ËΩØ‰∏≠Êñ≠

    hash = *(unsigned long *)&ct->tuplehash[IP_CT_DIR_REPLY].hnnode.pprev;
    reply_hash = hash_conntrack(net, &ct->tuplehash[IP_CT_DIR_REPLY].tuple);

    ct->timeout += nfct_time_stamp;   // Êõ¥Êñ∞ËøûÊé•Ë∂ÖÊó∂Êó∂Èó¥ÔºåË∂ÖÊó∂Âêé‰ºöË¢´ GC
    atomic_inc(&ct->ct_general.use);  // ËÆæÁΩÆËøûÊé•ÂºïÁî®ËÆ°Êï∞Ôºü
    ct->status |= IPS_CONFIRMED;      // ËÆæÁΩÆËøûÊé•Áä∂ÊÄÅ‰∏∫ confirmed

    __nf_conntrack_hash_insert(ct, hash, reply_hash);  // ÊèíÂÖ•Âà∞ËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™ÂìàÂ∏åË°®

    local_bh_enable();                // ÈáçÊñ∞ÊâìÂºÄËΩØ‰∏≠Êñ≠

    nf_conntrack_event_cache(master_ct(ct) ? IPCT_RELATED : IPCT_NEW, ct);
    return NF_ACCEPT;
}
```

ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞Ôºå**ËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™ÁöÑÂ§ÑÁêÜÈÄªËæë‰∏≠ÈúÄË¶ÅÈ¢ëÁπÅÂÖ≥Èó≠ÂíåÊâìÂºÄËΩØ‰∏≠Êñ≠**ÔºåÊ≠§Â§ñËøòÊúâÂêÑÁßçÈîÅÔºå ËøôÊòØÁü≠ËøûÈ´òÂπ∂ÂèëÂú∫ÊôØ‰∏ãËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™ÊÄßËÉΩÊçüËÄóÁöÑ‰∏ªË¶ÅÂéüÂõ†Ôºü„ÄÇ

struct nf_nat_l4proto {
    u8 l4proto; // Protocol numberÔºå‰æãÂ¶Ç IPPROTO_UDP, IPPROTO_TCP

    // Ê†πÊçÆ‰º†ÂÖ•ÁöÑ tuple Âíå NAT Á±ªÂûãÔºàSNAT/DNATÔºâ‰øÆÊîπÂåÖÁöÑ L3/L4 Â§¥
    bool (*manip_pkt)(struct sk_buff *skb, *l3proto, *tuple, maniptype);

    // ÂàõÂª∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂîØ‰∏ÄÁöÑ tuple
    // ‰æãÂ¶ÇÂØπ‰∫é UDPÔºå‰ºöÊ†πÊçÆ src_ip, dst_ip, src_port Âä†‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈöèÊú∫Êï∞ÁîüÊàê‰∏Ä‰∏™ 16bit ÁöÑ dst_port
    void (*unique_tuple)(*l3proto, tuple, struct nf_nat_range2 *range, maniptype, struct nf_conn *ct);

NAT ÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉÂáΩÊï∞ÊòØ¬†`nf_nat_inet_fn()`ÔºåÂÆÉ‰ºöÂú®‰ª•‰∏ã hook ÁÇπË¢´Ë∞ÉÁî®Ôºö

-   `NF_INET_LOCAL_OUT`

‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØÈô§‰∫Ü¬†`NF_INET_FORWARD`¬†‰πãÂ§ñÂÖ∂‰ªñ hook ÁÇπÈÉΩ‰ºöË¢´Ë∞ÉÁî®„ÄÇ

**Âú®Ëøô‰∫õ hook ÁÇπÁöÑ‰ºòÂÖàÁ∫ß**Ôºö**Conntrack > NAT > Packet Filtering**„ÄÇ¬†**ËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™ÁöÑ‰ºòÂÖàÁ∫ßÈ´ò‰∫é NAT**¬†ÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫ NAT ‰æùËµñËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™ÁöÑÁªìÊûú„ÄÇ
![upgit_20221117_1668675238.png](https://gitee.com/rykren/images/raw/master/2022/11/upgit_20221117_1668675238.png)

<center>Fig. NAT</center>

```
unsigned int
nf_nat_inet_fn(void *priv, struct sk_buff *skb, const struct nf_hook_state *state)
{
    ct = nf_ct_get(skb, &ctinfo);
    if (!ct)    // conntrack ‰∏çÂ≠òÂú®Â∞±ÂÅö‰∏ç‰∫Ü NATÔºåÁõ¥Êé•ËøîÂõûÔºåËøô‰πüÊòØÊàë‰ª¨‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàËØ¥ NAT ‰æùËµñ conntrack ÁöÑÁªìÊûú
        return NF_ACCEPT;

    nat = nfct_nat(ct);

    switch (ctinfo) {
    case IP_CT_RELATED:
    case IP_CT_RELATED_REPLY: /* Only ICMPs can be IP_CT_IS_REPLY.  Fallthrough */
    case IP_CT_NEW: /* Seen it before? This can happen for loopback, retrans, or local packets. */
        if (!nf_nat_initialized(ct, maniptype)) {
            struct nf_hook_entries *e = rcu_dereference(lpriv->entries); // Ëé∑ÂèñÊâÄÊúâ NAT ËßÑÂàô
            if (!e)
                goto null_bind;

            for (i = 0; i < e->num_hook_entries; i++) { // ‰æùÊ¨°ÊâßË°å NAT ËßÑÂàô
                if (e->hooks[i].hook(e->hooks[i].priv, skb, state) != NF_ACCEPT )
                    return ret;                         // ‰ªª‰ΩïËßÑÂàôËøîÂõûÈùû NF_ACCEPTÔºåÂ∞±ÂÅúÊ≠¢ÂΩìÂâçÂ§ÑÁêÜ

                if (nf_nat_initialized(ct, maniptype))
                    goto do_nat;
            }
null_bind:
            nf_nat_alloc_null_binding(ct, state->hook);
        } else { // Already setup manip
            if (nf_nat_oif_changed(state->hook, ctinfo, nat, state->out))
                goto oif_changed;
        }
        break;
    default: /* ESTABLISHED */
        if (nf_nat_oif_changed(state->hook, ctinfo, nat, state->out))
            goto oif_changed;
    }
do_nat:
    return nf_nat_packet(ct, ctinfo, state->hook, skb);
oif_changed:
    nf_ct_kill_acct(ct, ctinfo, skb);
    return NF_DROP;
}
```

È¶ñÂÖàÊü•ËØ¢ conntrack ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏çÂ≠òÂú®ÔºåÂ∞±ÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÊó†Ê≥ïË∑üË∏™Ëøô‰∏™ËøûÊé•ÔºåÈÇ£Â∞±Êõ¥‰∏çÂèØËÉΩÂÅö NAT ‰∫ÜÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Áõ¥Êé•ËøîÂõû„ÄÇ

Â¶ÇÊûúÊâæÂà∞‰∫Ü conntrack ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊòØ¬†`IP_CT_RELATED`„ÄÅ`IP_CT_RELATED_REPLY`¬†Êàñ¬†`IP_CT_NEW`¬†Áä∂ÊÄÅÔºåÂ∞±ÂéªËé∑Âèñ NAT ËßÑÂàô„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÊ≤°ÊúâËßÑÂàôÔºåÁõ¥Êé•ËøîÂõû¬†`NF_ACCEPT`ÔºåÂØπÂåÖ‰∏ç ÂÅö‰ªª‰ΩïÊîπÂä®ÔºõÂ¶ÇÊûúÊúâËßÑÂàôÔºåÊúÄÂêéÊâßË°å¬†`nf_nat_packet`ÔºåËøô‰∏™ÂáΩÊï∞‰ºöËøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•Ë∞ÉÁî®¬†`manip_pkt`¬†ÂÆåÊàêÂØπÂåÖÁöÑ‰øÆÊîπÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂ§±Ë¥•ÔºåÂåÖÂ∞ÜË¢´‰∏¢ÂºÉ„ÄÇ

### Masquerade

NAT Ê®°Âùó

-   ‰∏ÄËà¨ÈÖçÁΩÆÊñπÂºèÔºö`Change IP1 to IP2 if matching XXX`„ÄÇ
-   È´òÁ∫ßÈÖçÁΩÆÊñπÂºèÔºö`Change IP1 to dev1's IP if matching XXX`ÔºåËøôÁßçÊñπÂºèÁß∞‰∏∫ Masquerade„ÄÇ

Masquerade ‰ºòÁº∫ÁÇπÔºö

-   ‰ºòÁÇπÔºö**ÂΩìËÆæÂ§áÔºàÁΩëÂç°ÔºâÁöÑ IP Âú∞ÂùÄÂèëÁîüÂèòÂåñÊó∂ÔºåNAT ËßÑÂàôÊó†ÈúÄÂÅö‰ªª‰Ωï‰øÆÊîπ**„ÄÇ
-   Áº∫ÁÇπÔºö**ÊÄßËÉΩÊØîÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÁßçÊñπÂºèË¶ÅÂ∑Æ**„ÄÇ

## 4.6¬†`nf_nat_packet()`ÔºöÊâßË°å NAT

```
// net/netfilter/nf_nat_core.c

/* Do packet manipulations according to nf_nat_setup_info. */
unsigned int nf_nat_packet(struct nf_conn *ct, enum ip_conntrack_info ctinfo,
               unsigned int hooknum, struct sk_buff *skb)
{
    enum nf_nat_manip_type mtype = HOOK2MANIP(hooknum);
    enum ip_conntrack_dir dir = CTINFO2DIR(ctinfo);
    unsigned int verdict = NF_ACCEPT;

    statusbit = (mtype == NF_NAT_MANIP_SRC? IPS_SRC_NAT : IPS_DST_NAT)

    if (dir == IP_CT_DIR_REPLY)     // Invert if this is reply dir
        statusbit ^= IPS_NAT_MASK;

    if (ct->status & statusbit)     // Non-atomic: these bits don't change. */
        verdict = nf_nat_manip_pkt(skb, ct, mtype, dir);

    return verdict;
}
```

```
static unsigned int nf_nat_manip_pkt(struct sk_buff *skb, struct nf_conn *ct,
                     enum nf_nat_manip_type mtype, enum ip_conntrack_dir dir)
{
    struct nf_conntrack_tuple target;

    /* We are aiming to look like inverse of other direction. */
    nf_ct_invert_tuplepr(&target, &ct->tuplehash[!dir].tuple);

    l3proto = __nf_nat_l3proto_find(target.src.l3num);
    l4proto = __nf_nat_l4proto_find(target.src.l3num, target.dst.protonum);
    if (!l3proto->manip_pkt(skb, 0, l4proto, &target, mtype)) // ÂçèËÆÆÁõ∏ÂÖ≥Â§ÑÁêÜ
        return NF_DROP;

    return NF_ACCEPT;
}
```

‰ºòÂÖàÁ∫ß‰ªéÈ´òÂà∞‰ΩéÔºö

2.  ÂáèÂ∞è GC Êó∂Èó¥
    
    ËøòÂèØ‰ª•Ë∞ÉÂ∞è conntrack ÁöÑ GCÔºà‰πüÂè´ timeoutÔºâÊó∂Èó¥ÔºåÂä†Âø´ËøáÊúü entry ÁöÑÂõûÊî∂„ÄÇ

    Â¶ÇÊûúÂØπËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÁΩëÁªúÁéØÂ¢ÉÂíåÈúÄÊ±ÇÈùûÂ∏∏Ê∏ÖÊ•öÔºåÈÇ£ÂèØ‰ª•Â∞ÜËøô‰∏™Êó∂Èó¥Ë∞ÉÂà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂêàÁêÜÁöÑ„ÄÅË∂≥Â§üÂ∞èÁöÑÂÄºÔºõ Â¶ÇÊûú‰∏çÊòØÈùûÂ∏∏Á°ÆÂÆöÁöÑËØùÔºåËøòÊòØ**Âª∫ËÆÆ‰øùÂÆà‰∏Ä‰∫õÔºå‰æãÂ¶ÇËÆæÁΩÆ 6 ‰∏™Â∞èÊó∂**¬†‚Äî‚Äî ËøôÂ∑≤ÁªèÊØîÈªòËÆ§ÂÄº 5 Â§©Â∞èÂ§ö‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

# 7. ÊÄªÁªì

ËøûÊé•Ë∑üË∏™ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈùûÂ∏∏Âü∫Á°Ä‰∏îÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÁΩëÁªúÊ®°ÂùóÔºå‰ΩÜÂè™ÊúâÂú®Â∞ëÊï∞Âú∫ÊôØ‰∏ãÊâç‰ºöÂºïËµ∑ÊôÆÈÄöÂºÄÂèëËÄÖÁöÑÊ≥®ÊÑè„ÄÇ

‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåL4LB Áü≠Êó∂È´òÂπ∂ÂèëÂú∫ÊôØ‰∏ãÔºåLB ËäÇÁÇπÊØèÁßíÊé•ÂèóÂ§ßÈáèÂπ∂ÂèëÁü≠ËøûÊé•ÔºåÂèØËÉΩÂØºËá¥ conntrack table Ë¢´ÊâìÁàÜ„ÄÇÊ≠§Êó∂ÁöÑÁé∞Ë±°ÊòØÔºö

-   ÂÆ¢Êà∑Á´ØÂíå L4LB Âª∫ËøûÂ§±Ë¥•ÔºåÂ§±Ë¥•ÂèØËÉΩÊòØÈöèÊú∫ÁöÑÔºå‰πüÂèØËÉΩÊòØÈõÜ‰∏≠Âú®Êüê‰∫õÊó∂Èó¥ÁÇπ„ÄÇ
-   ÂÆ¢Êà∑Á´ØÈáçËØïÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÊàêÂäüÔºå‰πüÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂ§±Ë¥•„ÄÇ
-   Âú® L4LB ËäÇÁÇπÊäìÂåÖÁúãÔºåÂÆ¢Êà∑Á´ØËøáÊù•ÁöÑ TCP SYNC ÂåÖ L4LB Êî∂Âà∞‰∫ÜÔºå‰ΩÜÊ≤°ÊúâÂõû ACK„ÄÇÂç≥ÔºåÂåÖ Ë¢´ÈùôÈªò‰∏¢ÂºÉ‰∫ÜÔºàsilently droppedÔºâ„ÄÇ

Ê≠§Êó∂ÁöÑÂéüÂõ†ÂèØËÉΩÊòØ conntrack table Â§™Â∞èÔºå‰πüÂèØËÉΩÊòØ GC ‰∏çÂ§üÂèä Êó∂ÔºåÁîöËá≥ÊòØ¬†[GC Êúâbug](https://github.com/cilium/cilium/pull/12729)„ÄÇ

# 8. ÈôÑÂΩï

## 8.1 Á¨¨‰∏Ä‰∏™ SYN ÂåÖÁöÑÈáç‰º†Èó¥ÈöîËÆ°ÁÆóÔºàLinux 4.19.118 ÂÆûÁé∞Ôºâ

Ë∞ÉÁî®Ë∑ØÂæÑÔºö`tcp_connect() -> tcp_connect_init() -> tcp_timeout_init()`„ÄÇ

```
// net/ipv4/tcp_output.c

{

// include/net/tcp.h
static inline u32 tcp_timeout_init(struct sock *sk)
{
    // Ëé∑Âèñ SYN-RTOÔºöÂ¶ÇÊûúËøô‰∏™ socket ‰∏äÊ≤°Êúâ BPF Á®ãÂ∫èÔºåÊàñËÄÖÊúâ BPF Á®ãÂ∫è‰ΩÜÊâßË°åÂ§±Ë¥•ÔºåÈÉΩËøîÂõû -1
    // Èô§ÈùûÁî®Êà∑Ëá™Â∑±ÁºñÂÜô BPF Á®ãÂ∫èÂπ∂ attach Âà∞ cgroup/socketÔºåÂê¶ÂàôËøôÈáåÈÉΩÊòØÊ≤°Êúâ BPF ÁöÑÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§ËøôÈáåËøîÂõû -1
    timeout = tcp_call_bpf(sk, BPF_SOCK_OPS_TIMEOUT_INIT, 0, NULL);

    if (timeout <= 0)                // timeout == -1ÔºåÊé•‰∏ãÊù•‰ΩøÁî®ÈªòËÆ§ÂÄº
        timeout = TCP_TIMEOUT_INIT;  // ÂÆèÂÆö‰πâÔºåÁ≠â‰∫éÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑ HZ Êï∞Ôºå‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØ 1 ÁßíÔºåËßÅ‰∏ãÈù¢
    return timeout;
}

// include/net/tcp.h
#define TCP_RTO_MAX    ((unsigned)(120*HZ))
#define TCP_RTO_MIN    ((unsigned)(HZ/5))
#define TCP_TIMEOUT_MIN    (2U) /* Min timeout for TCP timers in jiffies */

ss ÂëΩ‰ª§Áî®‰∫éÊòæÁ§∫socketÁä∂ÊÄÅ. ‰ªñÂèØ‰ª•ÊòæÁ§∫PACKET sockets, TCP sockets, UDP sockets, DCCP sockets, RAW sockets, Unix domain socketsÁ≠âÁ≠âÁªüËÆ°. ÂÆÉÊØîÂÖ∂‰ªñÂ∑•ÂÖ∑Â±ïÁ§∫Á≠âÂ§ötcpÂíåstate‰ø°ÊÅØ. ÂÆÉÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈùûÂ∏∏ÂÆûÁî®„ÄÅÂø´ÈÄü„ÄÅÊúâÊïàÁöÑË∑üË∏™IPËøûÊé•ÂíåsocketsÁöÑÊñ∞Â∑•ÂÖ∑.

```bash
root@node3:~# ss -h
Usage: ss [ OPTIONS ]
       ss [ OPTIONS ] [ FILTER ]
   -h, --help          this message
   -V, --version       output version information
   -n, --numeric       don't resolve service names
   -r, --resolve       resolve host names
   -a, --all           display all sockets
   -l, --listening     display listening sockets
   -o, --options       show timer information
   -e, --extended      show detailed socket information
   -m, --memory        show socket memory usage
   -p, --processes     show process using socket
   -i, --info          show internal TCP information
       --tipcinfo      show internal tipc socket information
   -s, --summary       show socket usage summary
       --tos           show tos and priority information
   -b, --bpf           show bpf filter socket information
   -E, --events        continually display sockets as they are destroyed
   -Z, --context       display process SELinux security contexts
   -z, --contexts      display process and socket SELinux security contexts
   -N, --net           switch to the specified network namespace name

   -4, --ipv4          display only IP version 4 sockets
   -6, --ipv6          display only IP version 6 sockets
   -0, --packet        display PACKET sockets
   -t, --tcp           display only TCP sockets
   -S, --sctp          display only SCTP sockets
   -u, --udp           display only UDP sockets
   -d, --dccp          display only DCCP sockets
   -w, --raw           display only RAW sockets
   -x, --unix          display only Unix domain sockets
       --tipc          display only TIPC sockets
       --vsock         display only vsock sockets
   -f, --family=FAMILY display sockets of type FAMILY
       FAMILY := {inet|inet6|link|unix|netlink|vsock|tipc|xdp|help}

   -K, --kill          forcibly close sockets, display what was closed
   -H, --no-header     Suppress header line
   -O, --oneline       socket's data printed on a single line

   -A, --query=QUERY, --socket=QUERY
       QUERY := {all|inet|tcp|udp|raw|unix|unix_dgram|unix_stream|unix_seqpacket|packet|netlink|vsock_stream|vsock_dgram|tipc}[,QUERY]

   -D, --diag=FILE     Dump raw information about TCP sockets to FILE
   -F, --filter=FILE   read filter information from FILE
       FILTER := [ state STATE-FILTER ] [ EXPRESSION ]
       STATE-FILTER := {all|connected|synchronized|bucket|big|TCP-STATES}
         TCP-STATES := {established|syn-sent|syn-recv|fin-wait-{1,2}|time-wait|closed|close-wait|last-ack|listening|closing}
          connected := {established|syn-sent|syn-recv|fin-wait-{1,2}|time-wait|close-wait|last-ack|closing}
       synchronized := {established|syn-recv|fin-wait-{1,2}|time-wait|close-wait|last-ack|closing}
             bucket := {syn-recv|time-wait}
                big := {established|syn-sent|fin-wait-{1,2}|closed|close-wait|last-ack|listening|closing}
```

```yaml
name: vlan
topology:
  nodes:
    spine1:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/vyos:1.4
      cmd: /sbin/init
      binds:
        - /lib/modules:/lib/modules
        - vyos/config-spine1:/opt/vyatta/etc/config

    spine2:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/vyos:1.4
      cmd: /sbin/init
      binds:
        - /lib/modules:/lib/modules
        - vyos/config-spine2:/opt/vyatta/etc/config

    leaf1:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/vyos:1.4
      cmd: /sbin/init
      binds:
        - /lib/modules:/lib/modules
        - vyos/config-leaf1:/opt/vyatta/etc/config

    leaf2:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/vyos:1.4
      cmd: /sbin/init
      binds:
        - /lib/modules:/lib/modules
        - vyos/config-leaf2:/opt/vyatta/etc/config

    server1:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      exec:
      - ip addr add 10.10.0.2/24 dev eth1
      - ip route replace default via 10.10.0.1

    server2:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      exec:
      - ip addr add 10.10.0.3/24 dev eth1
      - ip route replace default via 10.10.0.1

    server3:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      exec:
      - ip addr add 10.10.0.4/24 dev eth1
      - ip route replace default via 10.10.0.1

    server4:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      exec:
      - ip link add link eth1 name eth1.10 type vlan id 10
      - ip addr add 10.10.10.2/24 dev eth1.10
      - ip link set dev eth1.10 up
      - ip route replace default via 10.10.10.1

    server5:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      exec:
      - ip link add link eth1 name eth1.11 type vlan id 11
      - ip addr add 10.10.11.2/24 dev eth1.11
      - ip link set dev eth1.11 up
      - ip route replace default via 10.10.11.1

    server11:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      exec:
      - ip addr add 10.11.20.2/24 dev eth1
      - ip route replace default via 10.11.20.1

    server12:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      exec:
      - ip addr add 10.11.20.3/24 dev eth1
      - ip route replace default via 10.11.20.1

    server13:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      exec:
      - ip link add link eth1 name eth1.21 type vlan id 21
      - ip addr add 10.11.21.2/24 dev eth1.21
      - ip link set dev eth1.21 up
      - ip route replace default via 10.11.21.1

    server14:
      kind: linux
      image: rykren/nettools:latest
      exec:
      - ip link add link eth1 name eth1.22 type vlan id 22
      - ip addr add 10.11.22.2/24 dev eth1.22
      - ip link set dev eth1.22 up
      - ip route replace default via 10.11.22.1

  links:
  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth1", "spine1:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth2", "spine2:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf2:eth1", "spine1:eth2"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf2:eth2", "spine2:eth2"]

  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth11", "server1:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth12", "server2:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth13", "server3:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth14", "server4:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf1:eth15", "server5:eth1"]

  - endpoints: ["leaf2:eth11", "server11:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf2:eth12", "server12:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf2:eth13", "server13:eth1"]
  - endpoints: ["leaf2:eth14", "server14:eth1"]
```
